channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Christmas trees and pallet dumped on Nile Street, 19th February
item.description:
Several Christmas trees and a wooden pallet dumped near 40 Nile St. They have been there for several weeks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Provost Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree is damaging property, 19th February
item.description:

item.title: Huge amounts of abandoned furniture in manley court, 19th February
item.description:
Lots of piled up mattresses, fridges, random furniture on manley court - this has been going on for months and hackney council reported it as resolved when it’s all still there- even obscuring access to/from the basement premises.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manley Court, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses dumped for the past 2 weeks, 19th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leabank Square, Hackney, London

item.title: Unotified traffic works, 19th February
item.description:
We werent told about this works in advance (its directly outside my house), its blocking part of the road, and also earlier in the week they had blocked off half the road and werent even doing anything, just sitting in their vans. They are also very noisey. It start on Monday.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodcombe Crescent, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
